Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery wine-jar, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as pressed meat.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393402) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393402)
